experiences.title: Capstone Project
experiences.subtitle: Kohler Co.
workDescription: Working on developing an AI based Automated Inspection System capable of inspecting manufacturing processes by employing advanced computer vision and machine learning techniques. This will improve the speed, accuracy & consistcy of defect detection to meet the stringent quality control standards at Kohler.

Additionally, will be creating a defect library that can be used to identify defects combined with the cutting-edge sensor technology and ML algorithms to seamlessly fit into the existing manufacturing operating.

experiences.title: Student Research

workDescription: Conducting a series of controlled experiments inspired by the paper 'Towards Robots that Influence Humans Over Long-Term Interaction', focusing on the application and testing of interaction scenarios using the GEM e2 vehicle. Working on developing advanced pedestrain detection & controls algorithm to be implemented using the GEMStack technology developed by AutonomouStuff's GEM e2 or e4 vehicle.

experiences.title: Robotics R&D Intern
experiences.subtitle: Rucha Yantra LLP
workDescription: Aided in the development of an automated system for high-precision manufacturing, utilizing computer vision to accurately locate critical points on cylindrical units for robotic automation. This initiative helped enhance operational accuracy and safety by reducing human interaction with high-pressure helium gas cylinders.

Collaborated on enhancing autonomous operations by integrating computer vision algorithms that dynamically adjusted robotic mechanisms in real-time, effectively improving production efficiency through reduced processing times.

Contributed to improve the vision based path following for Automated Guided Vehicles (AGV's), automating material handling in warehouse settings and effectively reducing labor demands wile improving workflow efficiancy.

Gained extensive hands-on experience with ROS, Linux, and OpenCV. Collaborated closely with the R&D team to troubleshoot, optimize, and advance the integration of sophisticated sensors and camera systems into industrial automation projects.

experiences.title: Embedded Systems Intern
experiences.subtitle: UFF
workDescription: Led a small team of two in designing and developing a smart portable billing device aimed at improving operational efficiency in restaurants.

Developed a compact billing solution using an ESP32 microcontroller and IoT technologies, featuring a thermal printer for quick receipt issuance. The device incorporated Python-based enhancements to the user interface, supporting robust transaction handling, real-time data synchronization, and remote management capabilities. These improvements facilitated quicker and more accurate transactions in restaurant settings.
The deployment of the smart billing device reduced the reliance on manual order processing, cutting down customer wait times for ordering by over 75% and making the dining experience more efficient.
